shortdesc.$: You can use the rinse aid system and rinse aid to get tableware and glasses rinsed perfectly without marks.

link.@target: Rinse aid
Setting the amount of rinse aid
Switching the rinse aid system off

shortdesc.$: For optimum drying results, use rinse aid.

p.$: Only use rinse aid for domestic dishwashers.

link.@target: Adding rinse aid

BSHCollectionOfElements.$: , add rinse aid. Only use rinse aid for domestic dishwashers.
Press the catch on the lid of the dispenser for rinse aid

p.$: Add rinse aid up to the max mark.
If rinse aid spills out, remove it from the tub.
Spilled rinse aid can cause excessive frothing during the wash cycle.
Close the lid of the dispenser for rinse aid.

link.@target: Adding rinse aid

title.$: Setting the amount of rinse aid

shortdesc.$: If there are streaks or water marks on tableware, change the amount of rinse aid.

BSHCollectionOfElements.$: To open the basic settings, press
repeatedly until the right amount of rinse aid has been set.

p.$: A low setting adds less rinse aid during the wash cycle and reduces streaking on tableware.
A higher setting adds more rinse aid during the wash cycle, reduces water marks and improves the drying result.

title.$: Switching the rinse aid system off

shortdesc.$: If you find the rinse aid refill indicator irritating, e.g. when using combined detergents with a rinse aid component, you can switch the rinse aid system off.

p.$: The function of rinse aid is limited with combined detergents. You will generally get better results using rinse aid.

BSHCollectionOfElements.$: To open the basic settings, press

p.$: The rinse aid system is switched off and the rinse aid refill indicator is deactivated.
